page.title: 02Farming Facts, Horse-Eye
page.content: Although Horse-Eye Level is used mainly for grazing, a few drained fields grow cereals. Hay and Straw Bales used for animal feed & bedding are a small feature of the area. The changing shape of the bale is of a little interest. The early small round bale was changed to a small rectangle. This, however, became a fire hazard & also soaked up the rain water. So now they have reverted to a round shape once more, though larger & the rain just rolls off. Another changing face of farming is the increased use of black plastic & old tyres as clamps for storage of hay, straw, silage etc. The 4 privately owned freehold farms are worked by owner or tenant farmers. There are 3 silage towers in this area. A serious pollution problem growing in this area is the discarded plastic fertilizer bags in the hedges.
